text:
If you’ve been dying to see Kesha on tour, no more “Praying” necessary — the songstress is hitting the road this fall.

Kesha announced North American tour dates on Tuesday (Aug. 1), titled the Rainbow Tour after her forthcoming album, Rainbow, which is due Aug. 11 via Kemosabe Records/RCA Records. The six week, 21-date trek marks Kesha’s first solo tour in four years, since 2013’s Warrior Tour.

Kicking off in Birmingham, Alabama on Sept. 26, the tour will continue throughout October and end at Los Angeles’ Hollywood Palladium on Nov. 1. Prior to the official start of the Rainbow Tour, Kesha will also be playing three West Coast shows: KAABOO festival in Del Mar, California (Sept. 15), M Resort Casino & Spa in Las Vegas (Sept. 16), and iHeartRadio Music Festival in Las Vegas (Sept. 23).

Explore Explore Kesha See latest videos, charts and news See latest videos, charts and news

“My new album ‘Rainbow’ is dedicated to my fans. And I’m so excited to be able to invite you all to come boogie with me on my new ‘Rainbow Tour’,” Kesha said in a statement. “I would not have made it to this point without my animals and supporters so now come out and join the celebration with me.”

As indicated by the tour name, Kesha will perform songs from her new album as well as crowd-pleasing hits like “Tik Tok” and “Your Love is My Drug.” Fans who purchase a ticket to the tour will receive a physical copy of Rainbow.
title: Kesha Announces North American Rainbow Tour, Her First Solo Trek Since 2013

meta_data.body: If you've been dying to see Kesha on tour, no more "Praying" necessary -- the songstress is hitting the road this fall.Kesha announced North American tour dates on Tuesday (Aug. 1), titled the Rainbow Tour after her forthcoming album, Rainbow, which is due Aug. 11 via Kemosabe Records/RCA Records. The six week, 21-date trek marks Kesha's first solo tour in four years, since 2013's Warrior Tour.Kicking off in Birmingham, Alabama on Sept. 26, the tour will continue throughout October and end at Los Angeles' Hollywood Palladium on Nov. 1. Prior to the official start of the Rainbow Tour, Kesha will also be playing three West Coast shows: KAABOO festival in Del Mar, California (Sept. 15), M Resort Casino & Spa in Las Vegas (Sept. 16), and iHeartRadio Music Festival in Las Vegas (Sept. 23). “My new album ‘Rainbow’ is dedicated to my fans. And I'm so excited to be able to invite you all to come boogie with me on my new ‘Rainbow Tour’,” Kesha said in a statement. “I would not have made it to this point without my animals and supporters so now come out and join the celebration with me.” As indicated by the tour name, Kesha will perform songs from her new album as well as crowd-pleasing hits like "Tik Tok" and "Your Love is My Drug." Fans who purchase a ticket to the tour will receive a physical copy of Rainbow.Tickets will be available to the public starting Saturday, Aug. 5 at 10 a.m. local time at KeshaOfficial.com. A Kesha fan presale begins Thursday, Aug. 3, at 10 a.m. local time. Fans can try for a chance at a presale opportunity by listening to and sharing tracks from the new album ‘Rainbow’ at tnspk.co/KeshaRainbowPresale. Check out the full list of dates below. Rainbow Tour 2017September 26 - Birmingham, AL - Iron CitySeptember 27 - Nashville, TN - Ryman AuditoriumSeptember 29 - Atlanta, GA - Coca-Cola RoxySeptember 30 - Charlotte, NC - The Fillmore CharlotteOctober 2 - Raleigh, NC - The RitzOctober 4 - Boston, MA - House of BluesOctober 6 - Silver Spring, MD - The Fillmore Silver SpringOctober 7 - Philadelphia, PA - The Fillmore PhiladelphiaOctober 9 - New York, NY - Hammerstein BallroomOctober 13 - Lakewood, OH - Lakewood Civic AuditoriumOctober 15 - Detroit, MI - The Fillmore DetroitOctober 16 - Toronto, ON - RebelOctober 18 - Chicago, IL - Aragon BallroomOctober 19 - Milwaukee, WI - Eagles BallroomOctober 23 - Kansas City, MO - Uptown TheatreOctober 24 - Denver, CO - Fillmore AuditoriumOctober 25 - Salt Lake City, UT - The ComplexOctober 27 - Seattle, WA - Showbox SoDoOctober 28 - Portland, OR - Roseland Theatre (Daze of the Dead)October 31 - San Francisco, CA - Masonic AuditoriumNovember 1 - Los Angeles, CA - Hollywood Palladium
